title: Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery              Photo Gallery                    Pu‘u o Lokuana - A Ranger Lead Hike   20 Photos  Part of Hawai‘i Vocanoes National Park Kahuku Unit, Pu‘u o Lokuana is a grassy hill that appears peaceful, but its name refers to an intense downpour of cinder from fountains of lava.           Centennial Hike: Honu'ea, Endangered Hawksbill Sea Turtles of Hawai'i   20 Photos  May 28, 2016 - Lauren Kurpita and Park Ranger Andrea Kaawaloa-Okita lead a group on a three-mile roundtrip hike to Ka'ena to learn more about the nesting and monitoring activities of honu'ea, the human and cultural history of the area, and how eruptions in this coastal region have impacted both          High Lava Lake in Halema‘uma‘u - April 24, 2015 between 5:00 - 5:30 a.m.   8 Photos  The level of the summit lava lake has risen to its highest level since the summit eruption began in March 2008. It was measured at 20 m (66 ft) below the rim of the Overlook crater on April 23, and is at least a few meters (yards) higher this morning, April 24, 2015. Please note that a zoom lens was used taking these photos.            New Volunteer Training - March 2014    20 Photos  We welcome eight new volunteers. Mike, Lydia, Renata, Robin, Karen, Leanne, Tristan & Travis.          In den Vulkan - Into the Volcano   20 Photos  Ranger Eric bietet eine deutschsprachige Wanderung an vom Kilauea Besucherzentrum auf den Boden der Caldera. Volunteer Eric leads a German speaking ranger guided program from Kīlauea Visitor Center to the Floor of Kīlauea Caldera.          New Volunteer Training - December 2013   20 Photos  Ten new volunteers receive field training. Meet volunteers Albert, Bonnie, Jennifer, Kira, Larry, Mary, Nicolas, Russell, Shirley & Taysia.            Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park's 33rd Annual Cultural Festival - July 13, 2013   46 Photos  Ka ‘ike o ke keiki - The learning of the child: i ka nana a ‘ike - by observing, one learns; i ka ho‘olohe no a maopopo - in listening, one commits to memory; i ka hana no a ‘ike - by practice, one masters the skill.          Jaggar Museum & Halema‘uma‘u Overlook   32 Photos  Photo Gallery of Jaggar Museum and Halema‘uma‘u Overlook           ‘Ike Hana No‘eau   32 Photos  On April 3rd & 4th, 2013, park visitors celebrated the 50th Annual Merrie Monarch Festival with the island's cultural practitioners as they shared the arts and crafts of Hawai'i at Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park Kīlauea Visitor Center on the lānai.            Various Park Photos   20 Photos  Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park Photo Picks          Nēnē 'Ohana   6 Photos  Proud parents of three goslings!          Lava Trees   16 Photos  Lava trees are formed when fast moving lava flows around a tree. The cool and moist trunk causes the lava to crust around the tree. When the flow is short lived, it drains off leaving behind standing lava trees.            Media Quality Photos   6 Photos  The NPS Centennial Media-Quality Photo Gallery will provide an opportunity for all parks and programs to be showcased in a single online gallery to meet an increasing need for high-resolution photos to use in NPS communications and to share with the media.
